weka.etplugin

Class EntropyTrianglePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • weka.gui.visualize.PrintablePanel
              • weka.etplugin.EntropyTrianglePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible, TechnicalInformationHandler, PrintableHandler

    public class EntropyTrianglePanel
extends PrintablePanel
implements TechnicalInformationHandler
    This panel coordinates the different elements of the Entropy Triangle plot.

    Inherits from the PrintablePanel the possibility to print the panel to various file formats. The Print dialog is accessible via Ctrl+Alt+Shift+"Left Mouse Click".

    For more information about the Entropy Triangle, see

    Valverde-Albacete, F. J., & Peláez-Moreno, C. (2010). Two information-theoretic tools to assess the performance of multi-class classifiers. Pattern Recognition Letters, Volume 31, Issue 12, 1 September 2010, Pages 1665-1671.

    To use the Entropy Triangle from Java code it is needed to train and evaluate the classifiers before adding the data to the plot, like in the following example: 
     
        public static void main(String[] args) {

                JFrame frame = new JFrame();
                EntropyTrianglePanel et = new EntropyTrianglePanel();

                frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
                frame.add(et);
                frame.setVisible(true);
                frame.pack();

                try {
                        DataSource source = new DataSource("./datasets/segment-challenge.arff");
                        Instances train = source.getDataSet();
                        Instances test = DataSource.read("./datasets/segment-test.arff");
                        train.setClassIndex(train.numAttributes() - 1);
                        test.setClassIndex(test.numAttributes() - 1);

                        weka.classifiers.rules.ZeroR zr = new weka.classifiers.rules.ZeroR();
                        zr.buildClassifier(train);
                        Evaluation eval = new Evaluation(train);
                        eval.evaluateModel(zr, test);
                        et.addData(eval, zr, test.relationName(), null);

                        weka.classifiers.bayes.NaiveBayes nb = new weka.classifiers.bayes.NaiveBayes();
                        nb.buildClassifier(train);
                        eval = new Evaluation(train);
                        eval.evaluateModel(nb, test);
                        et.addData(eval, nb, test.relationName(), null);

                        weka.classifiers.trees.J48 j48 = new weka.classifiers.trees.J48();
                        j48.buildClassifier(train);
                        eval = new Evaluation(train);
                        eval.evaluateModel(j48, test);
                        et.addData(eval, j48, test.relationName(), null);;

                } catch (Exception e) {
                        System.out.println("Error on main");
                        e.printStackTrace();
                }
        }
    Author:
    Antonio Pastor

    • Method Detail

      • addInstancesFromFile

        public int addInstancesFromFile(Instances instances)
        Adds a set of instances to the data list of the plot, checks the compatibility of the instances with the checkInstance(Instance) method of the Instances class.
        Initialize the data list if necessary.
        Parameters:
        instances - the set of instances to add
        Returns:
        0 if the instances are added correctly, -1 if the instances do not have the metrics needed to plot the data and -2 if the new instances are not compatible.
        See Also:
        Instances.checkInstance(Instance)

      • addData

        public void addData(Evaluation ev,
           AbstractClassifier classifier,
           String str_dataset,
           String str_time)
             throws Exception
        Adds to the Entropy Triangle the data of a classifier evaluation process.
        Parameters:
        ev - performed evaluation on the classifier for the relation named str_dataser
        classifier - the evaluated classifier
        str_dataset - the name of the evaluated relation
        str_time - a string for the time attribute, if null is passed a new string with the current timestamp will be generated
        Throws:
        Exception - on errors calculating metrics from the Evaluation object

      • clearData

        public void clearData()
        Removes all data and resets the panel.

      • isSplit

        public boolean isSplit()
        Checks if the graph is showing the split data.
        Returns:
        true if the split data is visible

      • setSplit

        public void setSplit(boolean split)
        Sets the graph to show separately the data from input and output of the classifier if true is passed, or just the information of the joint probability distribution if false.
        Parameters:
        split - the new split state

      • setBaseline

        public void setBaseline(boolean show)
        Sets the visibility of the H(Px) lines for the different datasets present in the graph.
        Parameters:
        show - wether to show or not the lines
